results: Why Summaries of Research on Psychological Theories are Often Uninterpretable - Paul E. Meehl, 1990: Null hypothesis testing of correlational predictions from weak substantive theories in soft psychology is subject to the influence of ten obfuscating factors whose effects are usually (1) sizeable, (2) opposed, (3) variable, and (4) unknown.
